t: Job 37
“At*pn this also my heart trembles, And*ld leaps from its place.
Hear*ld attentively the thunder of His voice, And*ld the rumbling that*i comes from His mouth.
He*ld sends it forth under the whole heaven, His*ld lightning to the ends of the earth.
After*ld it a voice roars; He*ld thunders with His majestic voice, And*ld He does not restrain them when His voice is heard.
God*ld thunders marvelously with His voice; He*ld does great things which we cannot comprehend.
For*ld He says to the snow, ‘Fall on*i the earth’; Likewise*ld to the gentle rain and the heavy rain of His strength.
He*ld seals the hand of every man, That*ld all men may know His work.
The*ld beasts go into dens, And*ld remain in their lairs.
From*ld the chamber of*i the*i south*i comes the whirlwind, And*ld cold from the scattering winds of*i the*i north.*i
By*ld the breath of God ice is given, And*ld the broad waters are frozen.
Also*ld with moisture He saturates the thick clouds; He*ld scatters His bright clouds.
And*ld they swirl about, being turned by His guidance, That*ld they may do whatever He commands them On*ld the face of the whole earth.
He*ld causes it to come, Whether*ld for correction, Or*ld for His land, Or*ld for mercy.
“Listen*ln to this, O Job; Stand*ld still and consider the wondrous works of God.
Do*ld you know when God dispatches them, And*ld causes the light of His cloud to shine?
Do*ld you know how the clouds are balanced, Those*ld wondrous works of Him who is perfect in knowledge?
Why*ld are*i your garments hot, When*ld He quiets the earth by the south wind?*i
With*ld Him, have you spread out the skies, Strong*ld as a cast metal mirror?
“Teach*ln us what we should say to Him, For*ild we can prepare nothing because of the darkness.
Should*ld He be told that I wish*i to*i speak? If*ld a man were to speak, surely he would be swallowed up.
Even*ld now men*i cannot look at the light when*i it*i is*i bright in the skies, When*ld the wind has passed and cleared them.
He*ld comes from the north as*i golden splendor;*i With*ld God is*i awesome majesty.
As*ild for*i the Almighty, we cannot find Him; He*ild is*i excellent in power, In*ild judgment and abundant justice; He*ld does not oppress.
Therefore*ld men fear Him; He*ld shows no partiality to any who*i are*i wise of heart.”
